title: (x) Peter Pop and the Helicopters - Florentine Script II {SM (self)}
content:
The following font was identified as Shelley Andante. (I'm only sorry that the sample, which by the way is from 1979, is of such a reduced size.)   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050525001107im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/26564.gif)   
   
The caps, obviously not as Shelley Andante's though, had me going for a better match, which brought me first to [Embassy](http://web.archive.org/web/20050525001107/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/embassy/), and later to [Florentine Script II](http://web.archive.org/web/20050525001107/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/atflorentine-script-ii/)... (The "s" has me going for Florentine Script II over Embassy...) Still, I'd very much appreciate the opinion of you, thank you so much.
author: ssmm

comments.content: Thank you, Grant, for the tip. Yes, I had actually tried before also with Sackers English Script. Yet, taking a closer look at the "H", think I'd still go rather for Florentine Script II...
